Class BankVault

java.lang.Object
  BankVault

public class BankVault
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements a LEAKY bank vault to demonstrate POOR encapsulation. The vault stores three kinds of wealth: cash, gold bars and bonds. Your challenge is to figure out how to break the bank and steal its wealth (setting the amounts of each to less than their initial values). There is a way for you to steal from each. Can you figure it out?

Encapsulation encompasses two important ideas:

  1. Hiding the details of a class's implementation revealing only its public interface (the stuff you need to know to use the class).
  2. Ensuring that objects of a class cannot be corrupted or invalidated either accidentally or maliciously.

I've provided this Javadoc revealing the interface for this class, but you're only getting its class file, which prevents you from seeing the implementation (which would make finding the bugs easy). This class has flaws in its encapsulation. If you can figure them out, you'll be able to break into the vault and REDUCE the wealth to 0!

Bugs: Can you break into the bank vault???

Author:
The TA
